alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:28PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Floyd and central Pike Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Boldman, or near Pikeville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Zebulon and Chloe around 435 PM EDT. Raccoon around 440 PM EDT. Kimper, Phyllis and Fishtrap Lake around 445 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Biggs, Mcandrews, Coleman, Fedscreek and Phelps. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 1 and 8. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 2. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County near mile marker 20, and between mile markers 22 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
